result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc A Glidden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the co-defendant (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 52 months bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 02-06-2017:   CFTS (granting presentence credit missing from original judgment of conviction).  AMENDED 03-01-2017:  CFTS (per amended revocation order and warrant and presentence credit that was miscalculated).

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant came to Felony window stating that DMV suspended his license for 1 year as a result of his conviction in 13CF1601 and requested that his JOC be corrected.  The Court waived any DLS in 13CF1601 and 14CF636 at the PLEAS.  There is nothing that can be corrected because a DLS wasn't ordered in either JOC.  Defendant took copies of both JOC's and clerk emailed Atty Parise explaining the conversation.
AMENDED 6-4-2014:  CONDITIONAL TIME IS STAYED.
BTC:  Conditional jail time was intended to be stayed.  Amend JOC accordingly.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Deft is retained by private counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
